<a href="https://invest.cytonics.com/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=0421" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="Cytonics" style="width:100%;max-width: 135px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="135" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby8zNDUvMTYxNTU1OTQwNC1DeXRvbmljc05ld0xvZ29fRi5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJjb21ldC1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19"></a>

<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning</strong>. Like most of you, we watched yesterday afternoon as a jury convicted former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin of murdering George Floyd.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The rest of the content in this email feels completely insignificant compared to that. So if you remember one name from this newsletter, let it be Darnella Frazier, who at 17 years old saw Chauvin pinning Floyd to the ground, took out her cellphone, recorded Floyd’s murder for ~10 minutes, uploaded it to Facebook, and sparked a global movement for racial justice.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STREAMING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/20/netflix-announces-disappointing-streamer-growth-2021?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Netflix to Everyone: Are You Still Watching?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Netflix still watching" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Nzk3L25ldGZsaXhfc3RpbGxfd2F0Y2hpbmcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In its earnings report yesterday, Netflix <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/20/netflix-nflx-q1-2021-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">acknowledged</a> the obvious: Things have gone downhill since episode 6 of <em>Bridgerton</em>. The streaming company added just 4 million new subscribers last quarter, lower than its estimate of 6 million and <em>way</em> down from the 16 million <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/netflix-faces-new-test-as-economies-reopen-11618911003?mod=hp_lista_pos3&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">it gained </a>in Q1 last year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Of course, last year was special: In prime position to benefit from pandemic lockdowns, Netflix managed to increase its subscriber base to 204 million and <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/29/netflix-raises-price-standard-premium-subscriptions?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bump up the price</a> on its standard streaming plan by $1 and its premium tier by $2. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>That might explain why revenue figures last quarter slightly topped expectations, despite the subscriber slowdown. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Netflix is facing strong headwinds in the new-old normal</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1. Covid-19 production delays </strong>led to what Netflix called a "lighter content slate" in the first half of this year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2. Couch-butt imprints are fading:</strong> Streaming went way up last year when other entertainment options, like going to museums or waiting in six-hour lines at Disneyland, shut down. Put simply, "There's a boost in engagement that you get when people are in a lockdown situation," Netflix Operations Chief Gregory Peters said. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now that people are dusting off their hard pants and Hinge profiles, streaming numbers are expected to slip. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">3. Viewers love Baby Yoda:</strong> After years of dominating the streaming industry, Netflix's market share <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2021-04-18/netflix-is-losing-market-share-but-is-it-losing-customers?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slipped below 50%</a> in Q1 for the first time ever, according to Parrot Analytics.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Disney+ topped </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/09/disney-reaches-100-million-subscribers?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">100 million subscribers</a></span><span> last year, just 16 months after its launch. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>NBC </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-11/nbc-tests-its-streaming-service-peacock-with-the-office-jump#:~:text=All%20nine%20seasons%20of%20%E2%80%9CThe,a%20year%20for%20the%20rights.?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">took back</a></span><span> some of Netflix's top hits (</span><span><em>The Office</em></span><span>, </span><span><em>Parks and Recreation</em></span><span>), and now streams them on its own service, Peacock. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Smaller streamers Discovery+ and Paramount+ quietly had </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/15/viacomcbs-discovery-quietly-incredible-years?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">strong launches</a></span><span>, too. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Despite the heated competition, Netflix still has first-mover advantage. Netflix remains the majority of viewers’ No. 1 choice of stream-and-chill service, and up to 92% of viewers that signed up for competing streaming services <a href="https://www.statista.com/statistics/778912/video-streaming-service-multiple-subscriptions/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">also have Netflix</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>things will get worse before they get better. Netflix predicted that in Q2 only 1 million net new subscribers will join the service—that would make it the <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/netflix-predicts-worst-quarter-for-streaming-growth-in-its-history-stock-falls-10-11618949977?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">worst quarter</a> for subscriber growth on record. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/20/super-league-doubt-manchester-city-backs?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Super League May Have Shorter Shelf-Life Than Quibi
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Super League, a breakaway European soccer competition that managed to simultaneously tick off soccer fans, players, and even prime ministers, appears to be crumbling less than 48 hours after it was announced. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">All six English Premier League clubs that had initially signed onto the Super League, including Manchester City and Liverpool, said they're <a href="https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/56823501?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">backing out</a> yesterday after feeling the heat from supporters. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why so much backlash?</strong> For people who love soccer, the Super League announcement felt like a middle finger followed by a back-to-back wedgie/swirly combo. It would concentrate broadcasting rights and player spending among a few elite teams, leaving the remaining European soccer clubs in a financially precarious position and unable to compete. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“It is not sport if the relationship between the effort and reward doesn't exist,” Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/SkySportsNews/status/1384488137867595776?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said yesterday</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The organizers of the Super League (many of them billionaires) clearly did not read the room before they tried to upend the building blocks of European soccer. It's unclear what will happen to the Super League from here.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/20/apple-announces-devices-custom-m1-chips-special-event?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Apple's Feeling Special
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/20/apple-announces-devices-custom-m1-chips-special-event" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A photograph of seven Apple iMac computers in a line, photographed from the side. From left to right, the computers are turquoise, yellow, orange, red, purple, blue, and silver. " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NzkzL2FwcGxlX2ltYWMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Apple</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At its first special event of the year, Apple <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/20/apple-event-live-updates.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made</a> a slew of iPad and computer announcements, including the first models with its in-house M1 chips. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For the 15 people who've been petitioning Tim Cook for an iMac in mustard yellow, he came through: The latest model of Apple's signature desktop features a slimmed-down design and several new color options—a throwback to Apple's Skittles-hued machines from the '90s. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Personal devices didn't get all the attention. Apple also announced: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A $29 traceable "Airtag" for easily misplaced items. Good thing Apple doesn't make any of those... </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Apple Card features for families, including shared credit lines </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Podcast subscriptions, in a swipe at Spotify</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Updated Apple TV box with a new remote and, most importantly, a trailer for </span><span><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=auxeLrtk7tk&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Ted Lasso</em> season 2</a></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Investors weren't blown away, and shares fell about 2% after the event.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What wasn't highlighted: </strong>iOS 14.5. Apple sneaked a mention on its website that its new operating system <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/20/apple-ios-14point5-release-date-with-att-idfa-restrictions-confirmed-for-next-week.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is available</a> starting next week. It'll bring landmark privacy updates, such as requiring apps to ask users to opt into data collection. Companies that rely on advertising, including Facebook, could see substantial hits to profits. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Never has a headline spoken to us more. Because even simple folks like us can understand the investment potential of this scientific breakthrough.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The alien lifeform (we’re pretty sure, again, not PhDs) in the image above is a patented, genetically engineered protein developed by <a href="https://invest.cytonics.com/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=0421" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Cytonics</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This protein, “CYT-108,” is a <strong style="color:#000">novel therapy developed to treat osteoarthritis</strong>—a debilitating disease that affects millions worldwide—and now you have a chance to <a href="https://invest.cytonics.com/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=0421" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">invest in its future</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A couple of key stats:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Cytonics has raised over </span><span><strong style="color:#000">$15 million to-date</strong></span><span>, including a $4 million investment from Synthes (a </span><span><strong style="color:#000">Johnson & Johnson</strong></span><span> company) and a successful SeedInvest round in 2019.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">CYT-108 is based on a naturally occurring molecule</strong></span><span>, and Cytonics’ research shows that it has the potential to </span><span><strong style="color:#000">reverse the progression of cartilage damage</strong></span><span> in arthritic joints. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">More than <strong style="color:#000">$180 billion</strong> is spent on treating osteoarthritis every year—but these treatments only focus on symptoms. Cytonics' revolutionary <strong style="color:#000">CYT-108 attacks osteoarthritis at the source</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://invest.cytonics.com/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=0421" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Invest in Cytonics before this opportunity closes on April 30</a>.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOGRAPHY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/20/nyt-analysis-shows-migration-patterns-prepandemic-stayed-mostly?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Mythbusting Covid Moving Patterns
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/20/nyt-analysis-shows-migration-patterns-prepandemic-stayed-mostly" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="PALM SPRINGS, CALIFORNIA - FEBRUARY 27, 2019: A U-Haul truck and other v..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Nzk2L3Nhbl9nb3Jnb25pb19wYXNzX3dpbmRfZmEuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Robert Alexander/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It may have felt like all your neighbors moved to the 'burbs for more space last year, but a new analysis shows they may just not like you.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2021/04/19/upshot/how-the-pandemic-did-and-didnt-change-moves.html?action=click&module=Spotlight&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYT's Upshot</a>, which analyzed 30 million change-of-address requests in 2020, "Migration patterns during the pandemic have looked a lot like migration patterns before it." In other words, the U-Haul that you spotted in 2020 was probably going to the same place as the one you spotted in 2019. After all, Miami had nice weather before the pandemic, too. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In some cases, however, the pandemic did cause more dramatic migration shifts, especially away from high-cost coastal cities. In 2020, metro NYC and SF experienced outflows at twice the rate of 2019. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>More people than usual also left energy boomtowns like Williston, ND, and others moved in greater numbers to vacation hotspots like Cape Cod and North Carolina's Outer Banks. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>This analysis highlights the stickiness of pre-pandemic migration patterns. "In many ways, the fundamentals in the data show that Austin is the next Austin," CBRE's research director Eric Willett told the NYT. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EXPLAINER
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/20/reader-qa-difference-spacs-ipos-direct-listings?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Reader Q&A: SPAC vs. Direct Listing vs. IPO
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Every Wednesday, we answer a reader-submitted question about business and the economy. Want clarification on something you read in the Brew? </em><a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/J0EH3zf3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Click here and ask</em></a><em>.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Question from too many of you to count: </strong>What's the difference between an IPO, a special purpose acquisition company (SPAC), and a direct listing?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew's answer: </strong>We can put this off no longer. At a high level…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">IPOs</strong></span><span> are a 6–12 month journey where a company works with investment banks and underwriters, who buy a bunch of shares and then sell them to investors in the public market during the actual IPO. Early investors are able to liquidate their shares, and the company raises new funds.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Direct listings</strong></span><span> skip the underwriting hullabaloo. But without that stability guarantee, direct listings can result in a more volatile opening. Some companies, like Coinbase, find that it's worth it to keep their hard-earned money out of bankers' hands.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">SPACs</strong></span><span>, aka "blank-check companies," offer yet another alternative path to public markets. A SPAC is a shell company that raises money through the traditional IPO process, then merges with a private company and takes it public. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The details can get hard to remember, so take <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/14/traditional-ipo-vs-spac-everything-need-know-taking-company-public?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this explainer</a> and bookmark it. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BREW'S BETS
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Put some Spring in your step. </strong><a href="https://bombas.com/pages/5-reasons-to-shop-bombas-socks?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=scontent&utm_campaign=cf_acq-bt_core-cp_sock-ca_core&utm_term=springfashion" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bombas</a> has socks in new, colorful spring hues (tie dye, stripe, cheetah!). <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">OZY Fest is back: </strong>The festival from our friends at OZY, described as "TED meets Coachella," is back for a virtual celebration of great entertainment, interactive experiences, and conversations with big names including Dr. Fauci, Condoleezza Rice, and Mark Cuban. width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Nzk3L25ldGZsaXhfc3RpbGxfd2F0Y2hpbmcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn its earnings report yesterday, Netflix \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/20/netflix-nflx-q1-2021-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eacknowledged\u003c/a\u003e the obvious: Things have gone downhill since episode 6 of \u003cem\u003eBridgerton\u003c/em\u003e. The streaming company added just 4 million new subscribers last quarter, lower than its estimate of 6 million and \u003cem\u003eway\u003c/em\u003e down from the 16 million \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/netflix-faces-new-test-as-economies-reopen-11618911003?mod=hp_lista_pos3\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eit gained \u003c/a\u003ein Q1 last year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOf course, last year was special: In prime position to benefit from pandemic lockdowns, Netflix managed to increase its subscriber base to 204 million and \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/29/netflix-raises-price-standard-premium-subscriptions?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebump up the price\u003c/a\u003e on its standard streaming plan by $1 and its premium tier by $2. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat might explain why revenue figures last quarter slightly topped expectations, despite the subscriber slowdown. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNetflix is facing strong headwinds in the new-old normal\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1. Covid-19 production delays \u003c/strong\u003eled to what Netflix called a \"lighter content slate\" in the first half of this year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2. Couch-butt imprints are fading:\u003c/strong\u003e Streaming went way up last year when other entertainment options, like going to museums or waiting in six-hour lines at Disneyland, shut down. Put simply, \"There's a boost in engagement that you get when people are in a lockdown situation,\" Netflix Operations Chief Gregory Peters said. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow that people are dusting off their hard pants and Hinge profiles, streaming numbers are expected to slip. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e3. Viewers love Baby Yoda:\u003c/strong\u003e After years of dominating the streaming industry, Netflix's market share \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2021-04-18/netflix-is-losing-market-share-but-is-it-losing-customers?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eslipped below 50%\u003c/a\u003e in Q1 for the first time ever, according to Parrot Analytics.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eDisney+ topped \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/09/disney-reaches-100-million-subscribers?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e100 million subscribers\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e last year, just 16 months after its launch. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eNBC \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-11/nbc-tests-its-streaming-service-peacock-with-the-office-jump#:~:text=All%20nine%20seasons%20of%20%E2%80%9CThe,a%20year%20for%20the%20rights.?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etook back\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e some of Netflix's top hits (\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe Office\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eParks and Recreation\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e), and now streams them on its own service, Peacock. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSmaller streamers Discovery+ and Paramount+ quietly had \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/15/viacomcbs-discovery-quietly-incredible-years?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estrong launches\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, too. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eDespite the heated competition, Netflix still has first-mover advantage. Netflix remains the majority of viewers’ No. 1 choice of stream-and-chill service, and up to 92% of viewers that signed up for competing streaming services \u003ca href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/778912/video-streaming-service-multiple-subscriptions/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealso have Netflix\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethings will get worse before they get better. Netflix predicted that in Q2 only 1 million net new subscribers will join the service—that would make it the \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/netflix-predicts-worst-quarter-for-streaming-growth-in-its-history-stock-falls-10-11618949977?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Super League, a breakaway European soccer competition that managed to simultaneously tick off soccer fans, players, and even prime ministers, appears to be crumbling less than 48 hours after it was announced. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAll six English Premier League clubs that had initially signed onto the Super League, including Manchester City and Liverpool, said they're \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/56823501?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebacking out\u003c/a\u003e yesterday after feeling the heat from supporters. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy so much backlash?\u003c/strong\u003e For people who love soccer, the Super League announcement felt like a middle finger followed by a back-to-back wedgie/swirly combo. It would concentrate broadcasting rights and player spending among a few elite teams, leaving the remaining European soccer clubs in a financially precarious position and unable to compete. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e“It is not sport if the relationship between the effort and reward doesn't exist,” Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/SkySportsNews/status/1384488137867595776?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid yesterday\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe organizers of the Super League (many of them billionaires) clearly did not read the room before they tried to upend the building blocks of European soccer. It's unclear what will happen to the Super League from here.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" Apple also announced: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA $29 traceable \"Airtag\" for easily misplaced items. Good thing Apple doesn't make any of those... \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eApple Card features for families, including shared credit lines \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePodcast subscriptions, in a swipe at Spotify\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eUpdated Apple TV box with a new remote and, most importantly, a trailer for \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=auxeLrtk7tk\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eTed Lasso\u003c/em\u003e season 2\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eInvestors weren't blown away, and shares fell about 2% after the event.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat wasn't highlighted: \u003c/strong\u003eiOS 14.5. Apple sneaked a mention on its website that its new operating system \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/20/apple-ios-14point5-release-date-with-att-idfa-restrictions-confirmed-for-next-week.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis available\u003c/a\u003e starting next week. It'll bring landmark privacy updates, such as requiring apps to ask users to opt into data collection. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt may have felt like all your neighbors moved to the 'burbs for more space last year, but a new analysis shows they may just not like you.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to the \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2021/04/19/upshot/how-the-pandemic-did-and-didnt-change-moves.html?action=click\u0026module=Spotlight\u0026pgtype=Homepage\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNYT's Upshot\u003c/a\u003e, which analyzed 30 million change-of-address requests in 2020, \"Migration patterns during the pandemic have looked a lot like migration patterns before it.\" In other words, the U-Haul that you spotted in 2020 was probably going to the same place as the one you spotted in 2019. After all, Miami had nice weather before the pandemic, too. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn some cases, however, the pandemic did cause more dramatic migration shifts, especially away from high-cost coastal cities. In 2020, metro NYC and SF experienced outflows at twice the rate of 2019. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMore people than usual also left energy boomtowns like Williston, ND, and others moved in greater numbers to vacation hotspots like Cape Cod and North Carolina's Outer Banks. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThis analysis highlights the stickiness of pre-pandemic migration patterns. \"In many ways, the fundamentals in the data show that Austin is the next Austin,\" CBRE's research director Eric Willett told the NYT. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" Want clarification on something you read in the Brew? \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/J0EH3zf3?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eClick here and ask\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eQuestion from too many of you to count: \u003c/strong\u003eWhat's the difference between an IPO, a special purpose acquisition company (SPAC), and a direct listing?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBrew's answer: \u003c/strong\u003eWe can put this off no longer. At a high level…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIPOs\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e are a 6–12 month journey where a company works with investment banks and underwriters, who buy a bunch of shares and then sell them to investors in the public market during the actual IPO. Early investors are able to liquidate their shares, and the company raises new funds.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDirect listings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e skip the underwriting hullabaloo. But without that stability guarantee, direct listings can result in a more volatile opening. Some companies, like Coinbase, find that it's worth it to keep their hard-earned money out of bankers' hands.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSPACs\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, aka \"blank-check companies,\" offer yet another alternative path to public markets. A SPAC is a shell company that raises money through the traditional IPO process, then merges with a private company and takes it public. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe details can get hard to remember, so take \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/14/traditional-ipo-vs-spac-everything-need-know-taking-company-public?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethis explainer\u003c/a\u003e and bookmark it. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
